intro: Cambessedea, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Aizoaceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plants are characterized by their fleshy, succulent leaves and showy, often yellow or orange flowers. They typically grow as annuals or short-lived perennials, adapting to harsh climatic conditions. Cambessedea species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and drought tolerance.
